Abstract: This workshop aims to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in the creation, evaluation, and application of multilingual data quality signals for building robust, fair, and inclusive language technologies.
Speakers: Anastasia Giachanou, Marco Guerini, Emma Strubell, Mark Stevenson, Magdalena Wolska

Title: COLM 2025 Workshop on AI Agents: Capabilities and Safety
Abstract: This workshop explores the capabilities and safety of AI agents, addressing the latest developments and challenges in the field.
Speakers: Aakanksha Chowdhery, Radu Florian, João Sedoc, Chi Wang

Title: First Workshop on the Interplay of Model Behavior and Model Internals
Abstract: Exploring the interplay between a model’s internal mechanisms and its externally observed behavior, with a focus on responsible AI.

Title: Workshop on LLM for Scientific Discovery: Reasoning, Assistance, and Collaboration (LM4Sci)
Abstract: This workshop focuses on exploring large language models in scientific discovery and research assistance.

Title: First Workshop on NLP 4 Democracy @ COLM 2025
Abstract: This workshop focuses on advances in NLP methods and applications that promote democracy worldwide.

Abstract: This workshop addresses challenges, methodologies, and evaluation protocols for test-time scaling of reasoning models.
